event.description:
The River Clean

The humble River Bonet hides the reality of years of illegal dumping.

The quest to Uncover Sligo's hidden beauty has revealed our hidden shame. Rubbish thats been dumped from the road by the public has, for years, been gathering unnoticed along the banks of the River Bonet... until now!

A collaborative effort involving multiple agencies and organisations working together so that we as community learn to protect this beautiful little corner of our country for a better future.

All participants are being asked to donate €15: (€5 goes towards the running of the event and €10 goes to the Rennafix fund.)

Eco-Adventure 'Bike Trip':

Two days Saturday and Sunday, Two times each day 10am or 2pm.

Meeting at Stanfords in Dromahair 9:45am for the morning session, 1.45pm for the afternoon session.

You will be guided by the qualified Mountain bike guides of NorthWestAdventure Tours from Stanfords in Dromahair, on-road, with occasional views of the river Bonet. The last section of your journey will take you off-road, onto forest path, to 'Ground Zero'.  Terrain not difficult but mountain bikes recommended and available, if you've any mountain bike questions contact Warner 0860229952 or William 0871259594.  (To avoid confusion booking must be completed on-line.)

For All

Wear clothes you don't mind getting mucky and have spare clothes for after your river clean-up session. Satellite images and a google maps link is available on the website www.havinalaugh.ie.

If you would like to join in please officially confirm your place through this Eco-Adventure booking Forum, Include your number and we will text you any changes 'weather permitting' in the lead up to the event. Car-pooling is encouraged, please indicate in your booking if you are willing to car pool and we will hook you up via e-mail.

organizer.long_description: Rennafix Group promoting posotive mental health through outdoor activities, connecting people and havin' a laugh.
organizer.name: RennafixGroup

The River Clean

The humble River Bonet hides the reality of years of illegal dumping.

The quest to Uncover Sligo's hidden beauty has revealed our hidden shame. Rubbish thats been dumped from the road by the public has, for years, been gathering unnoticed along the banks of the River Bonet... until now!

A collaborative effort involving multiple agencies and organisations working together so that we as community learn to protect this beautiful little corner of our country for a better future.

All participants are being asked to donate €15: (€5 goes towards the running of the event and €10 goes to the Rennafix fund.)

Eco-Adventure 'Hike Trip':

Two days Saturday and Sunday, Two times each day 10am or 2pm.

Meeting at the Lake Isle of Inisfree carpark at 9.45am for the morning session, 1.45pm for the afternoon session.

You will be guided an experienced Mountaineering guide from the Lake Isle around Trawnee Bay and through Cullentra Wood to 'Ground Zero'

For All

Wear clothes you don't mind getting mucky and have spare clothes for after your river clean-up session. Satellite images and a google maps link are available on the website www.havinalaugh.ie.

event.description:
The River Clean

The humble River Bonet hides the reality of years of illegal dumping.

The quest to Uncover Sligo's hidden beauty has revealed our hidden shame. Rubbish thats been dumped from the road by the public has, for years, been gathering unnoticed along the banks of the River Bonet... until now!

A collaborative effort involving multiple agencies and organisations working together so that we as community learn to protect this beautiful little corner of our country for a better future.

All participants are being asked to donate €15: (€5 goes towards the running of the event and €10 goes to the Rennafix fund.)

Eco-Adventure View 'Boat Tour': 

Two days Saturday and Sunday, Four times each day 10.30 am, 12.00pm, 1:30pm or 3.00pm.

Meeting at the Lake Isle of Inisfree pier 15mins before departure. 

Eddie of Lough Gill Tours will bring you on a scenic tour of the Lake Isle of Inisfree, around Cullantra woods and up the River Bonet where you will get to see where main clean-up effort is being focused. The boat tour is a 45 min round-trip for the purpose of viewing this hidden treasure and to see its retoration in progress. 

For All

Satellite images and a google maps link are available on the website www.havinalaugh.ie.

If you would like to join in please officially confirm your place through this Eco-Adventure booking Forum, Include your number and we will text you any changes 'weather permitting' in the lead up to the event.  Car pooling is encouraged, please indicate in your booking if you are willing to car pool and we will hook you up via e-mail.

event.description:
Festival of Colors also known as Holi is an Indian festival mostly popular in South asia, Europe and North America is to welcome the spring season. Festival of Color also signifies the integration of people with 'colors' beyond the barriers of Language, religion, race and culture.  All people threw color powder and paint on each other, more dancing and chasing with colors on the day... 
 
Festival attractions include:
 
- Bollywood dance cultural show
- DJ Music
- Color play
- Indian food stalls
- Exihibits

organizer.description: UNITAS a non profit, volunteer based organisation setup by Indian Diaspora in Ireland to promote Integration through Arts, Sports and Culture. UNITAS is an open platform to facilitate and promote integration activities to strengthen relationship between diverse Indian communities with other communities in Ireland. Our UNITAS platform is central hub for reaching out to all Indian communities in Ireland through series of exciting and inspiring Sports, Ats & Cultural events. All UNITAS activities are carried out by dedicated volunteers without whom Unitas would not have been successful. Core team are united volunteers from various parts of India in Ireland with different background and skills. UNITAS platform provides a fantastic network for volunteers, artists, culture lovers, sports lovers and like minded people to connect.
organizer.name: UNITAS ISAC Ltd

event.description:
Bliss Ireland - events that promote Sexual Freedom, Health & Pleasure in Mind, Body & Spirit

Bliss Ireland's 3rd annual Summer Festival, July 11th - 13th 2014, will bring you intriguing workshops, succulent playshops, fun & fascinating performances, delicious food, decadant experiences, sensual adult play and SO much more in a beautiful and private location all designed to open hearts & minds, raise consciousness & expand possibilities for connection, intimacy and bliss!

Check out previous events here & have a look at what folks have said about our events here!

The super-duper-early-bird tickets have SOLD OUT & the Super-Early-Bird tickets go on sale December 3rd - please note that the 2013 Festival SOLD OUT!


Sign up to the newsletter on the website to keep up to date with all our plans for the coming year, including

Bloom! - Bliss Spring Weekender in February

and of course the 2014 Summer Festival!

Notes: All Bliss Ireland events are open to those over the age of 18 and inclusive of all genders, sexual orientations and relational styles, unless stated otherwise for specific elements of an event.

The Summer Festival is an alcohol-free space & also free from recreational drug use, it is essential from our perspective that the event is a fully conscious one, in all regards, and open to all, including those with experience of drug & alcohol addiction. What event attenders engage in off-site is not our concern nor business, Bliss Ireland reserves the right to refuse admission to all its' events.

In the unlikely circumstance this event is postponed or cancelled all tickets are transferrable to another Bliss Ireland event and are non-refundable.


Last Updated: 27/11/13

organizer.description: Events & projects that aim to foster and promote Sexual Freedom, Health & Pleasure in Mind, Body & Spirit.
organizer.long_description: Events & projects that aim to foster and promote Sexual Freedom, Health & Pleasure in Mind, Body & Spirit.
organizer.name: Bliss Ireland

ticket.description: Super-Duper-Early-Bird Ticket for FULL entry to the Bliss Ireland Summer Festival, including two nights camping & entry to all items included on the Festival programme, July 11th to 13th 2014!

event.title: Bliss Summer Festival 2014

event.description:
Well, here it is folks. Macronite has been 3 years kicking the shit of Dolans, bringing you the freshest acts on one of the best sound systems, in one of the best venues to you, the best crowd in the country. And to celebrate, we have something real special lined up.

We're proud to announce that Macronite will be hosting the Dimensions Festival launch party and we have 2 tickets up for grabs for two lucky punters. Dimensions is one of the most highly regarded festivals in the world, bringing you the best lineups on the picturesque Adriatic coast.

And if that wasn't good enough, headlining on the night will be the great DjRum who tore the place apart in January '13 and has been our most requested return to date. DjRum blasted onto the scene with his first vinyl release 'Plead With Me' on Smokin' Sessions to great acclaim. With a string of other plates to follow up until last year when he pushed out one of the best albums of 2013 'Seven Lies' on 2nd Drop records. We're really excited to have him back, with his widely eclectic style ranging from dubstep to garage to techno to jungle to hiphop and beyond. This is going to be one to remember.

The lineup just keeps rolling out with support from local legends who need no introduction; mynameisjOHn and Mikey Fingers. These two lads have been destroying dance floors with their turntablist skills far and wide. 

On the terrace will by DIE & Elemental star Entropy backed up by Macronite lads Teddy and Sixs.

As mentioned before, in honor of holding the Dimensions Launch party we'll have two tickets up for grabs. Alls you have to do is book your Macronite tickets through Eventbrite, of which there'll only by 50 presale up for grabs. So good luck!

This one is probably going to be one of our best gigs yet... We guarantee it.

Doors - 10pm

Tax €8 before 11pm // €10 after.

ticket.description: All pre sale tickets enter into a draw for a Dimensions ticket
ticket.name: Early Bird

ticket.description: All pre sale tickets enter into a draw for a Dimensions ticket
ticket.name: Regular

event.title: Macronite's Dimensions Festival Launch & Third Birthday

event.description:
A Festival of all things Father Ted. Daytime entertainment and craic for all the family, and night-time (after 9pm) entertainment for adults only.

Weekend tickets include entry to all events and activities (including tea and cake at the Father Ted house).  Day tickets valid on Saturday ONLY and include all events and activities on Saturday (incl tea and cake at the Father Ted house).  PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU BOOK THE CORRECT WEEKEND TICKET, AS THERE WILL BE LOCATION TOURS ON FRIDAY, SATURDAY AND SUNDAY, AND DUE TO CAPACITY ISSUES, IT MAY NOT BE POSSIBLE TO CHANGE YOUR TOUR TO ANOTHER DAY.

FOR INFORMATION ON LOCAL ACCOMMODATION see kilfenoraclare  also worth checking airbnb

ALSO accommodation availabe in Ennistymon (5 miles/8km away) and Lisdoonvarna (5 miles/8km away) on www.discoverireland.ie

Proposed schedule includes:

Friday 30 May 2014

2pm-6pm Location Tours, including tea and cake at the Father Ted house

8pm Chinese Reception 

9pm Father Ted quiz followed by music with the Spinmaster til late

 

Saturday 31 May 2014

12 noon-6pm Father Ted location bus tours, including tea and cakes at the Father Ted house (LIMITED AVAILABILITY ticket holders only)

2pm-6pm games with Sister Attracta, including Brick Fada (how far can you throw Father Jack's Brick?), are those my feet?, snakes and ladders and more...,

8pm All Priests and Nuns karaoke

10pm Lovely Girls contest followed by music and dancing til late

Sunday 1 June 2013

12-3pm Father Ted  location bus tours, including tea and cakes at the Father Ted house (LIMITED AVAILABILITY ticket holders only)

3pm Pat Mustard's Grand Parade around the roundabout, including best dressed contest and prize giving

5pm Treasure Hunt

6pm Golden Cleric Awards

8pm EcumeniCeili and Ceili Dancing lessons with Sister Geraldine

Music til late

event.description:
Bia Lover Festival of Food is centred around the town of Athenry County Galway a medieval walled town, popularised by the song “The Field’s of Athenry”, a quaint town of about 4,000 people and dates back to 1235. The town has many small unique pubs, bars cafes and restaurants offering a fantastic range of European, Asian, African, and of course Irish cuisine.

The aim of Bia Lover is to celebrate and promote the wonderful variety and quality of food and drink produced in Galway and the West of Ireland.With this in mind the core event of the festival is a Producer’s Market where up to 70 artisan producers will showcase and sell their goods from June 20th to 22nd 2014. The market is located with the beautifully restored Athenry Castle as a backdrop. Cookery demonstrations featuring local produce and cook-off competitions will add to the experience, while stilt walkers and face painters will help keep the little ones entertained.

organizer.description: Bia Lover Festival of Food Athenry, together with its many small unique pubs, cafes, bars and restaurants brings together a unique mix of food markets and demonstrations, cookery competitions, special dinners, brunches and banquets, food-tastings, talks, exhibitions, childrens events and more
organizer.name: Liam Heneghan 086 8209584

event.title: Bia Lover Festival of Food Athenry Galway

event.description:
The BANFF MOUNTAIN FILM FESTIVAL features an exhilarating selection of short films that will transport you to the most captivating places on earth. Through the big screen experience amazing stories of adventure, journey to remote landscapes and mountain cultures, and witness adrenaline-fueled actions sports.

An inspiring experience that captures the spirit of adventure with great giveaways and prizes as well!

The films start at 7:30pm. UNRESERVED SEATING. Please bring along your printed confirmation voucher which is your ticket for the screening. Tickets are non-refundable.

For double the adventure also come along to the evening screening on Saturday night (10 May) and experience a second and totally different collection of Banff festival films. Discounted screening packages for both sessions are available (€23/ €20 concession).

organizer.description: Snowline Media delivers the best new adventure films to locations across the UK and Ireland.
organizer.name: Snowline Media

event.description:
IRISH PEN PRESENTS -
 
IrishPEN and The Workman's Club come together to present the first in a series of exciting new literary events in 2014. For one night only the stage will be taken by some of Dublin's best writers and poets, including -
 
Sarah Maria Griff - Broadcasting all the way from San Francisco, Griff is a poet, essayist for the Irish Times and the author of Not Lost from New Island Press

Stephen James Smith - slam poet and theatre-maker, fresh from performing at the Abbey Theatre's The Risen People (Noble Call)

Abby Oliviera - performance poet and veteran performer, a raw genius not to be missed
 
John Cummins - a fixture of Dublin's spoken word scene and  Irish Slam Poetry Champion 2012
 
Kerrie O'Brien - author of Out Of The Blueness, Kerrie's poetry has been featured at festivals such as Listowel Writer's Week, Cuisle International Festival 2013, the Bram Stoker Festival 2013 and more.
 
MORE TO BE ANNOUNCED
 
Irish PEN is affiliated to International PEN, a worldwide association of writers with over 140 branches in 90 countries. PEN stands for poets, playwrights, editors, essayists and novelists. The organisation exists to promote friendship, freedom of expression, international goodwill and intellectual co-operation between writers from a variety of mediums.
 
Doors at 7.30 - show begins at 8 sharp.

organizer.description: Irish PEN had its first meeting in June 1935. It is an association of Irish Writers, associate members and friends concerned in the written word, in freedom of expression and in the love of Literature. Irish PEN is affiliated to PEN International. To contact us, please visit www.irishpen.com, email vanessa@writing.ie. We're looking forward to meeting with you soon.
organizer.long_description: Irish PEN had its first meeting in June 1935. It is an association of Irish Writers, associate members and friends concerned in the written word, in freedom of expression and in the love of Literature. Irish PEN is affiliated to PEN International. To contact us, please visit www.irishpen.com, email vanessa@writing.ie. We're looking forward to meeting with you soon.
organizer.name: Irish PEN

ticket.name: The Spoken Word full price

event.title: Irish PEN Presents The PenCollective - A Night of Spoken Word

event.description:
In only few weeks Ireland will explode with hot Jamaican rhythms.
27th February on Dublin scene of The Grand Social, 28th February in Comedy Club in Cork and 1st March in Kelly’s Bar in Galway – big stars of reggae music will meet to play a gig different than others.
Different, not only because of the musical boom but mostly because there will be a real feast, celebration, experiencing, exploration and tasting. No borders! No prejudices! Above all national, religious, cultural or social divisions. Real event filled not only with positive music but with energy of art, food... All this is what each positive person wants the most.
The real Reggae Pie that wants to show how many things are connecting people. Two most important ingredients of this unusual pie are Cian Finn and Mesajah.
Hailing from the west of Ireland, Cian Finn is a vocalist and MC, inspired by the sounds of soul, blues and reggae. Currently working with some of the most respected acts in contemporary dub music, Cian has performed live with Mad Professor, Zion Train, Iration Steppas, Mungo’s Hi-Fi, Dubwise, Cornerstone Roots, Dubkasm, and Radikal Guru. His vocal tracks have been remixed by Manasseh, RSD, Phaeleh, and Indigo.He was lead vocalist and a founding member of Irish reggae group Intinn. They were a mainstay of the Irish festival circuit and over the last 7 years playing across the UK, France, Spain and Italy. In 2010 Intinn were declared “Best Upcoming Reggae Act in UK and Ireland” at the One Love Festival in London. Known for his vibrant onstage presence and impassioned voice, Cian’s shows voyage through reggae rhythms to bouncing dubstep, interspersed with soulful acapella moments. This is an artist rooted deeply in the Celtic spirit, his songwriting is infused with insight and positivity, carrying forward the flame of conscious music.
Cian Finn, with this gig on his Mother Land, will end a tour of US, Thailand, India, China and Europe. He will meet during Reggae Pie with Mesajah, rising sun of Polish reggae.
Mesajah (Manuel Rengifo Diaz) is an artist gifted with not only a voice but a great imagination as well. There’s not many like him to be able to derive from many different styles, interpret and create their own. He is present on the biggest reggae festivals, sharing the scene with the biggest: Gentleman, Stephen Marley , Wu Tang Clan ,Shaggy, Sizzla, Junior Kelly, Anthony. His concerts are a live transmission of positive vibrations and good word!
Reggae Pie wouldn’t have its taste without other ingredients, this is why, apart from Cian Finn and Mesajah, you will be able to see other stars connecting Jamaican heart with Irish soul: Bionic Rats (Dublin) and Brendan Rugus Mc Evans (Cork, Galway). They will be warming the audience up from 7pm up to 2-3 o’clock in the morning.
Another ingredient without which Reggae Pie couldn’t fully happen is a collection of artists from our streets. Graffiti artists! They are activists that show what hurts and inspires them in everyday life through their creations. Their message comes from painting and that is why Reggae Pie Project lead by Tzolkin Street will take place – Graffiti Battle and live painting with children from Down Syndrome Dublin organisation. Everyone will be able to see not only a ready masterpiece but most of all experience the cycle of creation. All this as a part of the gig!
You thought that’s all? Nope! We give you an opportunity to see and sense other forms of artistic message – art, collage, photography and tattoo project galleries. Everything created by young, inspired people from various backgrounds, living on the Emerald Island.
Reggae Pie is not only musical and artistic experience but also strictly physical. Important part of Reggae Pie is food and drink, that’s why everyone will have a chance to taste something of Irish and Polish cuisine. Something sweet, fruity, organic, real home baked goodness. All that paired with natural Polish lemonade – John Lemon and Yerbata – healthy and straight to the point!
For updates visit and pick your nearest location: https://www.facebook.com/gigs.dublin?fref=ts

So, to sum everything up:
Reggae Pie:
27/02/2014 – Dublin, venue: The Grand Social (35 Lower Liffey Street, Dublin 1), doors open at 7pm. Music until dawn (2-3am): Cian Finn i Mesajah, : Bionic Rats + DJs.
28/02/2014 – Cork; venue: City Limits Comedy Club (Coburg Street,Cork, Ireland) – doors open at 7pm. Music until dawn (2-3am): Cian Finn i Mesajah, Brendan Rugus Mc Evans + DJs.
01/03/2014 – Galway, venue: Kelly’s Bar (Bridge St, Galway, Ireland) – doors open at 9.00pm. Music until dawn (2-3am): Cian Finn i Mesajah, Brendan Rugus Mc Evans + DJs.
Tickets: before the event €20, on a day of event €25.
Tickets available at: www.bilety.gazeta.ie, www.ticketmaster.ie and local spots.
Official websites:
https://www.facebook.com/MESAJAHofficial
http://www.cianfinn.com/
http://thebionicrats.bandcamp.com/

event.description:
Julia Kent [Antony and the Johnsons / Rasputina / The Leaf Label - New York]

+ Caoimhín Ó Raghallaigh & David Donohoe - Debut Improv Performance

After years spent performing and recording with other artists and groups, most notably Antony & The Johnsons (with whom she continues to work), Rasputina, Stars Of The Lid and Michael Gira's Angels Of Light, New York City-based Julia Kent found her own voice with her solo debut, Delay, an exploration of the private emotional worlds that exist within the disjunctions and disorientations of travel, hailed for its “lovely, melancholy” compositions, full of “aching romanticism…rich melodicism, and detailed arrangements.” 

She toured to support it throughout Europe and North America, and subsequently released an EP, Last Day in July. In Green and Grey, her following solo record, she continued to use looped and layered cello, electronics, and field recordings to explore the intersections between the human world and the natural world, the melding of the technological and the organic, the patterns and repetitions that exist in nature and are mirrored in human creations, and the complexity and fragility of our relationships with one another and with the world that surrounds us. 

In March 2013 she released a third full-length solo record, "Character," on the Leaf Label. Kent recorded Character alone at home and further developed the layering techniques that she explored on her past solo work. It features cello accompanied by found sounds and field recordings.

"Incorporated sounds are important," Kent said in a statement. "They contrast and complement the cello, my primary instrument, and also evoke the concept of a voice without being, literally, a voice. So I used a lot of found and processed sounds to try to achieve that: from matches being struck, to wineglasses, to the sound of pen on paper, to an ancient autoharp that, over time, ended up being detuned in a way that created an amazing sonority."

There are also elements of looping in Character, the title of which is inspired by the notion that a person is a character within his or her own life story. 

"I ended up thinking about the process of life," she said. "How sometimes a narrative in fiction is meant to mirror the chronology of human life, and how our lives, in a way, can resemble works of fiction, but without the possibility of controlling the outcome the way an author can."

She was music composer for the Canadian documentary film The Boxing Girls of Kabul and the short film Birthplace.Her song "Dorval" was used in the 2008 film Trinidad. She has toured throughout Europe and North America, including appearances at Primavera Sound in Barcelona, the Donau festival in Austria, Meltdown in London, and the Unsound festival in New York City. 

Caoimhín Ó Raghallaigh Biography

Caoimhín Ó Raghallaigh plays traditional and contemporary folk music on Hardanger d'Amore and other fiddles.

In addition to being an established solo artist, he performs duos with dynamic Kerry accordion player Brendan Begley and Dublin uilleann piper Mick O'Brien, plays in a trio with Martin Hayes and Peadar Ó Riada, and is a member of two groups: The Gloaming and This Is How We Fly.

He has released eight CDs to date: Kitty Lie Over and Deadly Buzz with Mick O'Brien; A Moment of Madness with Brendan Begley; Triúr Arís andTriúr sa Draighean with Martin Hayes and Peadar Ó Riada; Comb Your Hair and Curl It with Mícheál Ó Raghallaigh and Catherine McEvoy; the eponymous debut from the band This is How We Fly; and his solo Where the One-Eyed Man is King.

As well his work in traditional Irish music, Caoimhín writes new contemporary material that explores the region where traditional music begins to disintegrate.

David Donohoe Biography 

I am an artist, designer and musician working with photography, video, sound, artist's books, drawing and writing. My current body of work All positions are partial examines the nature of impermanence in relation to identity and presence. With Peter Maybury and Marie-Pierre Richard I work as Image Text Sound, a collaborative art practice and publishing entity. 

I am currently coordinating Rainfear, an improvised music practice, which focuses on the development of visceral emotionally charged electronic music. Peter Maybury currently plays drums/ electronics in Rainfear. With Eamonn Doyle I am working on String Machine, a collaborative music project, seeking to open dialogue between acoustic and digital traditions and practices. 

I have released music on 9pt, D1 Recordings, Fällt, Force-inc, Mille-Plateaux and Minimise.

event.description:
DIY Public Relations For Your Business


If you’re like most business owners, getting a free plug on the radio or a good write up in a newspaper can be worth so much.   But, when you’re working with a shoe-string budget for marketing, hiring a public relations company may not always be practical or affordable.   The good news is that it’s possible to do your own PR! The secret is just knowing how to go about it and having access to the right tools.

PR Consultant Nicola Watkins has spent over 20 years working in public relations and has worked with many well-known consumer brands from Ireland and beyond including  Microsoft Xbox, The Irish Daily Star, GameStop, British Airways, CityJet, Sixt rent a car and Kobo as well as large music events such the MTV Music Awards,the Meteor Ireland Music Awards and Witnness Music Festival.

Nicola’s currently works with Netflix, Water Babies, Smartspot, vStream, Labfitness, WholeWorldBand and the Westport Festival of Music & Food.

Nicola will give you some hints and tips on how to do your own Public Relations which will help you raise your business' or product's profile.

You will also have time to Network before and after Nicola's presentation, so please bring lots of business cards.


This event is free to Network Ireland members.    Please register in advance.


Guests / Non Members : €15

 

NB  Membership to Network Ireland costs 100 euro for the year and you can sign up on the night.

organizer.description: Network Louth/Meath provides a forum where women in business, the professions and the arts can exchange business ideas and increase their business contacts. We hold monthly networking events in either Co. Louth or Co. Meath where a guest speaker is invited to educate, inform and entertain on topics of interest to business women. The Network offers members support, friendship and the opportunity to attend regular seminars and workshops on business topics, a forum for networking, learning and exchanging contacts and regular communications on issues and opportunities that may be of interest to them. http://www.networklouth.com/
organizer.long_description:
Network Louth/Meath provides a forum where women in business, the professions and the arts can exchange business ideas and increase their business contacts. We hold monthly networking events in either Co. Louth or Co. Meath where a guest speaker is invited to educate, inform and entertain on topics of interest to business women under the themes of My Work, My Life and My Play. The Network offers members support, friendship and the opportunity to attend regular seminars and workshops on business topics, a forum for networking, learning and exchanging contacts and regular communications on issues and opportunities that may be of interest to them.
Network Louth/Meath offers its members: - Opportunities to make business contacts and learn the technique of Networking. - Opportunities to promote your business through the branch and national websites, ezines, branch and national events - Mentoring service, which benefits both mentor and mentee. - PR opportunities through highlighting the success of its members in the media. - Representation of women in Business, the Professions and the Arts at a local, national and international level. - Offers an open, inclusive organisation that welcomes women from both the public and private sector, entrepreneurs and employees, professionals and artists in all business and industry areas. - Network Louth/Meath offers members a non-competitive and supportive environment where often business acquaintances become firm personal friends.
organizer.name: Network Ireland Louth/Meath

event.description:
The Music Composition Centre (Music Department, Trinity College Dublin) in association with the New Music Dublin Festival 2014, has invited composers, musicologists and practitioners to an International Conference entitled Composition in the 21st Century that will take place in Dublin in March 2014 (Conference 5-7 March & New Music Dublin Festival 7-9 March). The Conference will offer a forum to discuss aesthetic, technical, practical and economical issues affecting composers of different musical genres today.

Keynote speakers will be the internationally acclaimed composers Sir Harrison Birtwistle and Raymond Deane.

To download the Conference Programme, click here: Composition In The 21st Century (PDF 149kb)

organizer.description:
Conference Committee: Dr Evangelia Rigaki; Trinity College Dublin Dr Kevin O'Connell; Royal Irish Academy of Music Dr Wolfgang Marx; University College Dublin Dr Mark Fitzgerald; DIT Conservatory of Music and Drama.
Jenny Kirkwood is Conference Administrator for the Department of Music, Trinity College Dublin, and can be contacted at kirkwooj@tcd.ie for further information on the event.

event.description:
Fridays April 11th, 18th & 25th, 7pm - 10pm

at the Oscailt Centre, Dublin 4

Reflect ~ Release ~ Rejoice

Bliss Circles are an opportunity for those in one particular geographical

area to come together in community to explore the Bliss Ireland themes

of Sexual Freedom, Health & Pleasure in Mind, Body & Spirit. 

They are an opportunity to reconnect with friends & to meet like-

minded and like-hearted new friends while exploring the connections

between sexuality and spirituality in a way that encompasses our whole

experience as human beings. You are very warmly invited..... 



Circles are led by a very small number of experienced facilitators

approved by Bliss Ireland who have considerable experience both in

group facilitation & in one or more of the themes to be explored, with

the Dublin Circles to be led by Ailish Farragher.



These Dublin Circles are to be held over 3 consecutive Friday evenings

& each evening will have a different theme though one leads into the

next - these particular evenings are offered together as one event, one

package, as we feel it important, in order to build trust and community,

that those who come along attend all three gatherings.

More information to be come on each evening & the facilitators.....



Friday 11th April, 7.30pm - 10.30pm - Reflect

We reflect on what we deeply wish to achieve from this series of workshops through a simple exercise & setting our intention. We will gently visit boundaries & trust within the group. We will also bring our attention & awareness to being fully present & open, using words, breath & movement with facilitator, Ailish Farragher.


Friday 18th April 7.30pm - 10.30pm - Release

We explore barriers to intimacy and being fully present, both with

ourselves & others, through group & solo exercises. This evening

culminates in a moonlit shamanic ritual to shed these barriers, led by

guest facilitator & Four Winds shamanic practitioner, Maria McSweeney.

 



Friday 25th April 7.30 - 10.30pm  - Rejoice 

Having reflected and released it is now time to rejoice in this short series of workshops, the last evening in the series offers an opportunity to luxuriate in some aspects of this earthly, corporeal experience in the form of a deeply rich Adoration of the Senses Ritual based on ancient Tibetan Tantric practice & ritual with Beth Wallace, Bliss Ireland Founder & CEO. 



Spaces for this Bliss Circle are limited to 20 participtants only, demand

is expected to be high, and so you are encouraged to purchase your

tickets sooner rather than later!



For more information about our other events, projects & resources check

out the Bliss Ireland website, future events include the Summer

Festival, July 11th to 13th, Claregalway, Co Galway.



Notes: As with all Bliss Ireland events, the Bliss Circle is free from the

recreational use of drugs & alcohol, is open to all those over the age of

18, regardless of sexual orientation, relationship style, religious

belief or spritual practice & gender identity. In the unlikely circumstance

that this event, in part or in full, should be cancelled or postponed,

tickets are transferrable and non-refundable. For your comfort you are

requested to bring a cushion to sit on and a blanket to cover yourself to

each evening & to wear loose fitting comfortable clothes.

Bray Institute of Further Education are delighted to present their first seminar on Music Production and Sound Technology as part of the inaugural BIFE Arts Festival.

The seminar will take place in Bray Institute of Further Education on March 22nd from 10am. The seminar is free of charge and all are welcome.

We invite leading industry professionals in their field to come and speak about employment and education opportunities in the area of music production and sound technology in Ireland. There will also be a number of demonstrations and performances taking place on the day.

There are limited spaces available so early booking is advised.

The schedule of events for this exciting event is as follows:

 

10.00 – 10.45                                                                                      Gavin Glass

 

11.00 – 11.45                                                                                      Aza Hand

 

11.45 – 12.15                                                                                      Break

 

12.15 – 13.00                                                                                      Defekt

(Performance & discussion.)

 

13.15 – 14.00                                                                                      Sunil Sharpe

 

We look forward to seeing you all there!

event.description:
We are delighted to present "Limp" by Shaun Ryan & Kevin Minogue, the second of our two excellent Irish feature films from up and coming filmmakers. Shaun and Kevin are regular Little Cinema submitters and have created some of the most memorable and original shorts we've screened.


This is the link to the event on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/468118563311453/?fref=ts

Synopsis
The film follows the deterioration of a relationship told through the eyes of a man whose brain has been curdled by isolation. So desperate for companionship the man plays out a relationship between himself and a woman that he has killed but it isn't long before the corpse begins to deteriorate and the relationship follows suit. As the world the Man has built around himself begins to spiral out of control he watches on helplessly as it unravels the grim reality and the devastating truth of what he has done and what he must do...


**** Review: http://www.krank.ie/category/entertainment/limp-review/
Trailer: https://vimeo.com/23562184


Tickets are €5, but if you buy tickets to Trampoline also, you get to go to the Little Cinema on the 25th Feb for free!

Both Trampoline and :Limp are highly recommended and went down a storm at the Cork Indie Festival 2013.


Details of "Trampoline" by Tom Ryan are below:

**** Review: http://waytooindie.com/review/movie/trampoline/
Trailer: https://vimeo.com/69251803

organizer.description: The Little Cinema is an open mic for film-makers, screening short films on a monthly basis for almost 4 years

event.description:
``Bray Institute of Further Education are delighted to present their Acting seminar as part of the inaugural BIFE Arts Festival.

The seminar will take place in Bray Institute of Further Education on March 29th from 10am until 3pm. The seminar is free of charge and all are welcome.

The first half of the day will be consist of a movement workshop with Raymond Keane, whilst the latter half of the day will involve a talk and discussion with casting director Thyrza Ging.

Visitors can gain an insight into the skills required for a career in acting and also learn about current employment and progression opportunities. The BIFE Acting Seminar promises to be an enjoyable and informative event.

There are limited spaces available so early booking is advised.

The schedule of events for this exciting event is as follows:

 

10.00am                                                                                    Introduction

 

10.30am                                                                                    Workshop (physical theatre)

(Raymond Keane – actor, writer, director)

 

12.30pm                                                                                   Lunch

 

13.00 – 14.00pm                                                                        Talk

(Thyrza Ging - Casting Director with Louise Kiely Casting)

 

We look forward to seeing you all there!

event.description:
We are delighted to present "Trampoline" by Tom Ryan, the first of our two excellent Irish feature films from up and coming filmmakers.

Please bring along a copy of the receipt for the ticket, or the reference number from the ticket purchase. This is the link for the Facebook event for the screening: https://www.facebook.com/events/459036584196123/

Synopsis
Angie Corbett returns to her hometown in Tipperary after getting a teaching job at her old secondary school. While at home, Angie struggles to readjust to the life she thought she had left behind and at the same time, try to figure out what the next step in her life should be.

**** Review: http://waytooindie.com/review/movie/trampoline/
Trailer: https://vimeo.com/69251803



Tickets are €5, but if you buy tickets for both Trampoline and Limp, you get free in to the Little CInema on Tuesday 25th!

event.description:
One Direction Dream Package, Croke Park, Dublin Ireland (Saturday May 24th)

Live Nation Where We Are Tour, Logistics ATC/RTC Third Party Promotions

Sunday, May 25, 2014 from 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM (PDT)

Dublin 3, Ireland

Email Share Tweet

Event Details

1D Dream Experience



2 Nights Luxury Deluxe Suite at The Dublin Ritz Carlton (Themed and Decorated in your 1D pampered room) Only 12 minutes to Croke Park

2 Pink Zone Early Entrance VIP Tickets with an escort to the front scaffolding. (Essentially Front Row

Special Passes: You will have access to meet the band before or after the show. It is not a meet and greet in the sense of the word that Live Nation offered as Ultimate Packages on the last tour. It is a private hello and possibly a photo. You will have credentials for this provided by a third party associated with a record label. The purchaser must go through a screening process. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity. There will not be others in line witing for a 30 second type photo. This is intimate and since there are no publcly offered chance to meet the boys, its rare and coveted.

A GIANT Box of Swag, Tour items, tour Memorabilia, 24 x 40 Framed Personalized Where We Are Poster





Have questions about One Direction Dream Package, Croke Park, Dublin Ireland (Saturday May 24th)? Contact Live Nation Where We Are Tour, Logistics ATC/RTC Third Party Promotions
